member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.AnonymousDelegateInserter.GenericArgumentsDoNotMatchGenericParameters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference})
member.summary: A compiler method that was generated from the body of an anonymous delegate inside a generic method will itself be generic and will be instantiated with the generic parameters of the generic method. Return false if this is not the case, so that the caller knows that it is not dealing with an anonymous method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions
member.summary: Options that are used to control how much decompilation happens.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions.None
member.summary: Default value: all flags are false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions.AnonymousDelegates
member.summary: True if display classes should be decompiled into anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions.Iterators
member.summary: True if iterator classes should be decompiled into iterator methods.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions.Loops
member.summary: True if loop structures should be decompiled into high-level loops (for-statements, while-statements, etc.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler
member.summary: Provides methods that convert a given Metadata Model into an equivalent Code Model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.GetCodeModelFromMetadataModel(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly,Microsoft.Cci.PdbReader,Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions)
member.summary: Returns a mutable Code Model assembly that is equivalent to the given Metadata Model assembly, except that in the new assembly method bodies also implement ISourceMethodBody.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this decompiler. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
The root of the Metadata Model to be converted to a Code Model.
An object that can map offsets in an IL stream to source locations and block scopes. May be null.
Set of options that control decompilation.

member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this decompiler. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
The root of the Metadata Model to be converted to a Code Model.
An object that can map offsets in an IL stream to source locations and block scopes. May be null.
Set of options that control decompilation.

An object that can map offsets in an IL stream to source locations and block scopes. May be null.
Set of options that control decompilation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider)
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method.
member.param: The local scope provider to use for methods that have not been decompiled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetIteratorScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes, each defining an IL range in which an iterator local is defined. The scopes are returned by the MoveNext method of the object returned by the iterator method. The index of the scope corresponds to the index of the local. Specifically local scope i corresponds to the local stored in field <localName>x_i of the class used to store the local values in between calls to MoveNext.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetLocalScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local (block) scopes into which the CLR IL operations in the given method body is organized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetNamespaceScopes(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns zero or more namespace scopes into which the namespace type containing the given method body has been nested. These scopes determine how simple names are looked up inside the method body. There is a separate scope for each dotted component in the namespace type name. For istance namespace type x.y.z will have two namespace scopes, the first is for the x and the second is for the y.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetConstantsInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local constant definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetVariablesInScope(Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScope)
member.summary: Returns zero or more local variable definitions that are local to the given scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.IsIterator(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Returns true if the method body is an iterator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.Decompiler.LocalScopeProvider.GetSynchronizationInformation(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: If the given method body is the "MoveNext" method of the state class of an asynchronous method, the returned object describes where synchronization points occur in the IL operations of the "MoveNext" method. Otherwise the result is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies
member.summary: A mutator that copies metadata models into mutable code models by using the base MetadataMutator class to make a mutable copy of a given metadata model and also replaces any method bodies with instances of SourceMethodBody, which implements the ISourceMethodBody.Block property by decompiling the metadata model information provided by the properties of IMethodBody.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.localScopeProvider
member.summary: An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method. May be null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.sourceLocationProvider
member.summary: An object that can map offsets in an IL stream to source locations and block scopes. May be null.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.host
member.summary: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.options
member.summary: Decompiler options needed at the point that new source method bodies are created for each method definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider,Microsoft.Cci.ILocalScopeProvider,Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompilerOptions)
member.summary: Allocates a mutator that copies metadata models into mutable code models by using the base MetadataMutator class to make a mutable copy of a given metadata model and also replaces any method bodies with instances of SourceMethodBody, which implements the ISourceMethodBody.Block property by decompiling the metadata model information provided by the properties of IMethodBody.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
An object that can map some kinds of ILocation objects to IPrimarySourceLocation objects. May be null.
An object that can provide information about the local scopes of a method. May be null.
Set of options that control decompilation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ReplaceMetadataMethodBodiesWithDecompiledMethodBodies.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Replaces the body of the given method with an equivalent instance of SourceMethod body, which in addition also implements ISourceMethodBody, which has the additional property, Block, which represents the corresponding Code Model for the method body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder
member.summary: A traverser that visits every method body and collects together all of the private helper types of these bodies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.helperTypes
member.summary: Contains an entry for every type that has been introduced by the compiler to hold the state of an anonymous delegate or of an iterator. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these types should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperTypes of the methods containing the iterators and anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.helperMethods
member.summary: Contains an entry for every method that has been introduced by the compiler in order to implement anonymous delegates. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these members should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperMembers of the methods containing the anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.helperFields
member.summary: Contains an entry for every field that has been introduced by the compiler in order to implement anonymous delegates. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these members should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperMembers of the methods containing the anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.host
member.summary: An object representing the application that is hosting this decompiler. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.sourceLocationProvider
member.summary: An object that can map some kinds of ILocation objects to IPrimarySourceLocation objects. May be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.ISourceLocationProvider)
member.summary: A traverser that visits every method body and collects together all of the private helper types of these bodies.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this decompiler. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
An object that can map some kinds of ILocation objects to IPrimarySourceLocation objects. May be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IModule)
member.summary: Traverses only the namespace root of the given assembly, removing any type from the model that have the same interned key as one of the entries of this.typesToRemove.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition)
member.summary: Traverses only the nested types and methods and collects together all of the private helper types that are introduced by the compiler when methods that contain closures or iterators are compiled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Traverses only the (possibly missing) body of the method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.HelperTypeFinder.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Records all of the helper types of the method body into this.helperTypes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes
member.summary: A traverser for a mutable code model that removes a specified set of types from the model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes.helperTypes
member.summary: Contains an entry for every type that has been introduced by the compiler to hold the state of an anonymous delegate or of an iterator. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these types should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperTypes of the methods containing the iterators and anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes.helperMethods
member.summary: Contains an entry for every method that has been introduced by the compiler in order to implement anonymous delegates. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these members should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperMembers of the methods containing the anonymous delegates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes.helperFields
member.summary: Contains an entry for every field that has been introduced by the compiler in order to implement anonymous delegates. Since decompilation re-introduces the anonymous delegates and iterators, these members should be removed from member lists. They stick around as PrivateHelperMembers of the methods containing the anonymous delegates.
Allocates a traverser for a mutable code model that removes a specified set of types from the model.
member.param: A dictionary whose keys are the interned keys of the types to remove from member lists.
A dictionary whose keys are the interned keys of the methods to remove from member lists.
A dictionary whose keys are the interned keys of the methods to remove from member lists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IModule)
member.summary: Traverses only the namespace root of the given assembly, removing any type from the model that have the same interned key as one of the entries of this.typesToRemove.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.RemoveUnnecessaryTypes.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition)
member.summary: Traverses the specified type definition, removing any nested types that are compiler introduced private helper types for maintaining the state of closures and anonymous delegates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.SourceMethodBody.GetBlock
member.summary: Decompile the IL operations of this method body into a block of statements.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompiledBlock
member.summary: A delimited collection of statements to execute in a new (nested) scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompiledBlock.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Microsoft.Cci.UtilityDataStructures.Sublist{Microsoft.Cci.Analysis.BasicBlock{Microsoft.Cci.Analysis.Instruction}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: A delimited collection of statements to execute in a new (nested) scope.
member.param: The IL offset of the first statement in the block.
The IL offset of the first statement following the block.
A list of basic blocks that are contained inside this source block.
If false, the block is a helper block for the decompilation process and it should be removed during final cleanup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompiledBlock.StartOffset
member.summary: The IL offset of the first statement in the block.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompiledBlock.EndOffset
member.summary: The IL offset of the first statement following the block.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.DecompiledBlock.IsLexicalScope
member.summary: If false, the block is a helper block for the decompilation process and it should be removed during final cleanup.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.CompilationArtifactRemover.GetTypeFromHandle
member.summary: A reference to System.Type.GetTypeFromHandle(System.Runtime.TypeHandle).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.ClosureFieldMapper
member.summary: The purpose of this traverser is to discover the mapping between fields in a closure state class and the original locals and parameters that were captured into the closure state class, so that we can substitute field accesses with local and parameter accesses during decompilation of anonymous delegates. Things are complicated by having to deal with a variety of compilers that potentially use different name mangling schemes and moreover we might not have a PDB file available and so might not know the name of a local or parameter. The bottom line is that we cannot rely on naming conventions. Generally, we rely on the source operand of the first assignment to a state field as providing the local or parameter that is being captured. However, if an anonymous delegate uses a local that is not used outside of it (or other anonymous delegates) then a compiler (such as, alas, the C# compiler) might provide a state field for the local while not actually defining a real local of inserting an assignment to capture the value of the local in the state class before constructing a closure. We therefore recurse into anonymous delegate bodies to find assignments to state fields, assume those are captured locals, and then dummy up locals for use in the decompiled method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.PatternReplacer.ReplaceCompilerGeneratedLocalUsedForInitializersPattern(Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.BlockStatement)
member.summary: The source expression "new C(){ f1 = e1, f2 = e2, ... }" (where the f's can be fields or properties) turns into "cgl = new C(); cgl.f1 = e1; cg1.f2 = e2; ...". ("cgl" means "compiler-generated local".) Turn it into a block expression whose Statements are the statements above (but where the first one becomes a local declaration statement), and with an Expression that is just the local, cgl', where cgl' is a freshly created local.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.PatternReplacer.ReplacePlusAssignForStringPattern(Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.BlockStatement)
member.summary: For a string field, s, the source expression e.s += "" turns into a specific pattern. That pattern here looks like: i: push e i+1: push dup.s i+2: (!= dup (default_value string)) ? goto L2 : empty i+3: L1 i+4: pop i+5: push "" i+6: L2 i+7: pop.s = pop

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.PopCounter.TraverseChildren(Microsoft.Cci.IAnonymousDelegate)
member.summary: Do not count pops in lambdas: they must not be confused with pops that are not within them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.ILToCodeModel.PopReplacer.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IAnonymousDelegate)
member.summary: Do not replace pops in lambdas: they must not be confused with pops that are not within them.
